Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class Weapons

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.GameObject
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Weapons
public class Weapons extends GameObject
Represents a weapon upgrade collectible that permanently increases player damage. Unlike temporary power-ups (speed boost, shield), weapon upgrades are permanent for the level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Weapons

      public Weapons(float x, float y, float size, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion texture, int damageValue)
      Creates a new weapon collectible at the specified position. Weapons are spawned by MapManager during level initialization.
      Parameters:
      x - starting x position in world coordinates (pixels)
      y - starting y position in world coordinates (pixels)
      size - width and height of the weapon sprite (usually 16)
      texture - the visual representation of the weapon
      damageValue - the damage this weapon provides (1-3 typically)

  • Method Details

    • onCollected

      public void onCollected(Player player)
      Handles the weapon collection logic when the player touches it. Called by GameScreen when player bounds overlap weapon bounds.

      The weapon upgrade is permanent for the level but resets on: - Level restart (player dies and restarts) - New level (advancing to next level) - Game over (starting new game)

      Parameters:
      player - the player collecting this weapon

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Checks if the weapon is still available for collection. Used by GameScreen to determine if collision checking is needed.

      ```

      Returns:
      true if weapon can be collected, false if already collected

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Draws the weapon sprite if it's still active. Inactive weapons (already collected) are not rendered.

      This creates the visual effect of the weapon disappearing when collected, providing immediate visual feedback to the player.

      Overrides:
      draw in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      batch - the SpriteBatch to draw with (must be in drawing state)
